text:
3/III/17 - 0.35 l bottle @ post-ACBF tasting (home) - BB: 19/I/16 (2017-355) Thanks to 77ships for sharing the bottle!
Clear pale watery yellowish saké, no head. Aroma: lots of bread yeast, funky, bit oxidized, alcohol. MF: no carbon, medium body. Taste: sweet, pretty sugary, yeast. Aftertaste: all bread yeast, banana, more yeast, alcohol, sugary, unpleasant bitterness, more alcohol and yeast. Meh.
Bottle sample courtesy of 77ships, thanks! Clear golden yellow color, still. Aroma of feet, wet blankets. Taste is herbal, smooth, rich, grainy. Very tasty.
Pours very very clear yellowwhite. No head. Smell is super intense sake. Taste is strong, sweet , boozy, strong, bit grainy almost. Very nice

330 ml. bottle sampled. Shared with tderoeck post ACBF 2017. 2013 Vintage. Bottled 19.01.2016. Pale apple juice, hazy. Nose is sweet sake yeast, sugar, basic cheap sake rice, oily, apple. Taste is weak sweet yeast, cheap sake yeast, sugar, overly yeasty, sweat & apples. Yeasty body. Tastes cheap to me despite being a premium product. Expected more but I do not know much about sake.
KØLF 120816. THX to Beer5000. Clear golden color with no head. Flavor is rice, alcohol, ripe apple, citrus, yeast, fruit, pears. Nice sake.

Clear pale golden color, and off course no head. Ok intensity in the aroma. Medium + body and an oily texture. Nice round and mellow sweetness. Rice, mild basement, apple and some spices. A bit refreshing actually. Complex and tasty. Well masked alcohol.[Bottle at yngwie plaza]

Bottle. More or less clear in the glass, lightly oily. The aroma is very fruity, complex, with a nice alcohol burn, some cellar and a leathery, oxidized touch. Ripe peaches, notes of orange zest and mango. Some rice in the far back. Its full bodied, oily and warming on the palate. Some rice and meaty umami in the back of the flavor, its fruity as hell, in a ripe and canned way, with a very matured, aged, almost oxidized way, all lasting for a good while. Sure a delicious one. And complex indeed. 161014
Lys gul klar uten skum. Lukter noe trevirke, pære og alkohol. Kjenner godt alkoholen, litt hemmert. Fruktig mot epler og pærer. Kort. Sticky, nesten oljete.
UPDATED: AUG 19, 2016 Klar gul farge med intet skum. Lukter alkohol, eple,pære. Kjenner alkoholvarmen. Mild,rund smak. Søtlig og krydret avslutning.

350 ml bottle. Clear yellow golden body without any head. Quite strong in aroma, ripe apple and pear with sake yeast, rise and a hint of plum in the background. The flavor is definitively sake but at the same time totally different to any other sake I have tasted. Quite sweet, apple, pear and rise like expected from aroma, umami and something toffee or caramel like in the background. Tried to pare this with different kind of food, but thats difficult. My experience was definitively not fish, nor anything salt, difficult to find the right cheese as well, something sweet and fat seems to be the best but did not have any chocolate in the house. Totally unique experience for me and highly enjoyable.

Bottle, courtesy of Beer5000. Pours clear golden no head. Aroma of rice, ripe apples, pears, alcohol, yeast and fruitiness. Flavor is sweet and fruity with some ripe apples, slight caramel note, rice and warming alcohol. Medium to full body, no carbonation.
